newsitem.title: USA: MWRA proposes average 8.9 pct rate hike for FY '98.
newsitem.headline: MWRA proposes average 8.9 pct rate hike for FY '98.

text.p: Massachusetts Water Resources Authority (MWRA) proposed an average of 8.9 percent rate hike in wholesale water and sewer charges to the communities it serves to fund a $410 million expense budget for fiscal year 1998 that begins July 1.

MWRA spokeswoman Shelia McGann said in a telephone interview Thursday that debt service on bonds issued to finance construction of new facilities including the Deer Island Sewage Treatment Plant makes up 50.4 percent of the proposed budget.
MWRA said in a statement that the final cost of the Deer Island plant remains $3.6 billion and that debt service represents the largest increase in the new budget, up by $28 million over last year.

The plant "is now 90 percent complete," MWRA Executive Director Doug MacDonald said in a statement, adding, "New operating costs are under tight rein, but paying for the new plant and our other needed system improvements makes a budget increase unavoidable..."
Public hearings on the budget will be held in the Spring. A final budget is expected to be adopted in June.
MWRA's debt is rated single-A by both Moody's Investors and Standard & Poor's.
